A 3 day shadowing opportunity on the internal medicine ward at the hospital which taught me about multidisciplinary teamwork and communication as well as how to achieve the highest standard of patient care.

I had work experience in preparation for medicine at the Gudalur Adivasi Hospital in a tribal region of the Nilgiri Mountains in Southern India. The hospital is located in an area and amongst a people faced with gruelling adversity. The economic conditions were poor and there was no dearth of health ailments such as tuberculosis and sickle cell anaemia. The doctors working at this hospital showed true solidarity in serving the less fortunate. I was glad to have the opportunity to observe various parts of the functioning of the hospital, including the outpatient consultation, ward rounds, minor procedures and major surgeries. In the process, I was able to learn a great deal about the function of a healthcare system and the important qualities a doctor must have within areas such as critical thinking, communication, leadership, teamwork and empathy.
